1.text: The kingâ€™s heart in the hand of Jehovah is [as] brooks of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

2.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes; but Jehovah weigheth the hearts.

3.text: To exercise justice and judgment is more acceptable to Jehovah than sacrifice.

4.text: Lofty eyes, and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.

5.text: The thoughts of the diligent [tend] only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty, only to want.

6.text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting breath of them that seek death.

7.text: The devastation of the wicked sweepeth them away, because they refuse to do what is right.

8.text: Very crooked is the way of a guilty man; but as for the pure, his work is upright.

9.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a contentious woman, and a house in common.

10.text: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.

11.text: When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise; and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

12.text: One that is righteous wisely considereth the house of the wicked: he overthroweth the wicked to [their] ruin.

13.text: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also himself shall cry, and shall not be heard.

14.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger; and a present in the bosom, vehement fury.

15.text: It is joy to a righteous [man] to do what is right; but it is ruin for the workers of iniquity.

16.text: The man that wandereth out of the way of wisdom shall abide in the congregation of the dead.

17.text: He that loveth mirth shall be a poor man; he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.

18.text: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous, and a treacherous [man] in the stead of the upright.

19.text: It is better to dwell in a desert land. than with a contentious and irritable woman.

20.text: There is costly store and oil in the dwelling of a wise [man]; but a foolish man swalloweth it up.

21.text: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

22.text: A wise [man] scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.

23.text: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.

24.text: Proud, arrogant, scorner is his name who dealeth in proud wrath.

25.text: The desire of the sluggard killeth him; for his hands refuse to work:

26.text: He coveteth greedily all the day long; but the righteous giveth and spareth not.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more when they bring it with a wicked purpose!

28.text: A lying witness shall perish; and a man that heareth shall speak constantly.

29.text: A wicked man hardeneth his face; but as for the upright, he establisheth his way.

30.text: There is no wisdom, nor understanding, nor counsel against Jehovah.

31.text: The horse is prepared for the day of battle; but safety is of Jehovah.
